p: According to Burfield [ 51] a typical EO from Piper betle leaves is dominated by phenylpropanoids and aromatic compounds, can contain up to 40% eugenol, and up to 40% of carvacrol and chavicol taken together, while chavibetol is characteristic of the EOs from the whole plant. Other typical compounds are α terpinene, p-cymene, 1,8-cineole, β-caryophyllene, α-humulene, allyl pyrocatechol, allylcatechol, methyl eugenol, and estragol (methyl chavicol).
